reviews.text: Update: customer relations reached out to me and was very communicative and concerned about my experience. They offered me a gift card. I have to say, I&#39;m pretty impressed with this customer service!<br><br>I ordered take out from here tonight and was told it would be ready at 6:15 and to wait for a text to come inside and get it. At 6:40, I hadn&#39;t received a text so I called and a team member told me to keep waiting. I called back at 7:05 after waiting FIFTY minutes and still not receiving a text and was told someone would bring my food out. I finally received my food at 7:10 (never wound up getting a textNow I&#39;m eating cold food and was not offered any type of apology. I will not be returning to this location.

When they get it right the food is actually good. However it seems like the last several times I&#39;ve gotten curbside takeout something is wrong! This time the sides were ice cold not even warm and the sauces they didn&#39;t put the lids on all the way so the sauce went all over the food and the chicken was soggy from where it had been sitting in it. They should definitely speak to their back of house people putting the food together.

Pros:<br>- Nice interiors and atmosphere<br>- Smooth and safe curbside pickup experience (during COVID-19)<br>- Pleasant service<br>- Delicious food, big portions, good value in my book (like any other cheesecake factory)<br><br>Cons:<br>- Early on when they were transitioning to curbside pickup, they didn&#39;t include the complimentary bread a couple of times even when I asked for it in the online order. However, this issue seems fixed based on my recent orders.

The Chestnut Hill restaurant is the worst one in the chain--compared to others I&#39;ve been to in Florida and California. The food is mediocre at this one, and put on the lights!!!  It&#39;s like a dungeon in there!

Carlos Valencia, our waiter did a wonderful job of taking care of my family and I. Even with our rambunctious toddler he remained very accommodating.  The menu has something for everyone&#39;s particular taste. We&#39;ll be back for sure.<br><br>I must say the bathrooms are very clean and modern.  I&#39;ve learned over the years that one can tell a lot about a restaurant by how they maintain their bathrooms.<br><br>The brunch is surprisingly delicious.

Thank you, Cheesecake for taking the time to review and respond to my initial review. We returned a month later to get take out and the process was fast and seamless. We were very pleased and will return again. Thank you for listening and for taking customer service seriously.

No, we ordered a low carb low calorie cheesecake from this location. Big mistake. First of all, it was frozen on arrival when we picked it up curbside. They were supposed to thaw it out as we had ordered it in the morning. My girlfriend and I both had major gas all the night and the next day. Something was not right with this factory made cheesecake that cost $52 dollars.

If I could give 0 stars I would! I made a reservation hours in advance and got there on time to find out that I had to wait &#34;20-30 minutes to be seated.&#34; Truthfully, It was more than hour wait for a table. The best decision I made tonight was to go to the Besito Restaurant next door. I was seated right away without a reservation and enjoyed great dood and drinks. I recommend trying The Besito Restaurant.

This was absolutely disgusting to see. I wanted to go in and have a nice dinner with my mother that I haven&#39;t seen for a while (both of us are of Latin descent). We decided to go to this specific location after having a nice day in the mall. Then we saw that The Cheesecake Factory was there, and remembered how good the spinach dip was. <br><br>The man, for the purpose of this review is named Fred, asked for my name to put me on the list. He said 15-20 minutes. He was dressed in a server uniform. He had black glasses, full beard. <br><br>An old man and his wife come in (white couple). Fred tells them that their wait time is 5-10 minutes. <br><br>I tell my mother that if Fred sears this old white couple first, we are going to have an issue. <br><br>Fred sears this couple within a minute of them waiting, while my mother and I have already been waiting 8 minutes. I timed the whole thing. <br><br>A tall white woman dressed in all black (presumably the host) comes up the the host stand and gets three menus ready. Based on this information, my mother and I were not going to be seating next. Another group of three that arrived *after* my mother and I were going to be seated. <br><br>I let the white host know that she can take my name off the list because of Fred&#39;s inability to discern who was actually next because he was blinded by his own projection of internal hatred. The woman was also rude and looked oblivious about everything. <br><br>Don&#39;t go here if you&#39;re not visibly white, other wise you&#39;d be waiting for 15 minutes while everyone that came after you gets seated before you.

If you&#39;ve ever been to a cheesecake factory then you&#39;ll know precisely what to expect. Service was pleasant though not anything special (they were prompt in refilling our drinks which I always appreciate). The menu is huge (normal for cheesecake factory) and is also littered with ads which doesn&#39;t really bother me.  <br><br>Overall if you like cheesecake after your meal this is the place to go since they have me huge selection! Ironically the only real complain is there listing of the calories in each dish since the meals can be ridiculously high in them (ignorance is bliss!). <br><br>Ample parking here!

Great service! I&#39;ve been there twice and had Briana as our server both times. She is incredibly sweet and doesn&#39;t rush you to order. She checks on you just enough. The food is really good. Much better than the Cheesecake Factory in Braintree. I highly recommend and ask for Briana!

I have been to The Cheesecake Factory quite a few times and I always either leave super satisfied and full from a great meal or the opposite, feeling annoyed. <br>At the Chestnut Hill location (both here at the Shops at Chestnut Hill or at the former Atrium location, even though that one wasn&#39;t nearly as nice or spacious as here), I ALWAYS have a positive experience, which is telling. Out of four other locations I have been to, this is hands-down the best Cheesecake Factory around. Natick is subpar, Providence RI is horrible. I don&#39;t even remember if I have been to any others in the past years. <br>This location has a great setup with a perfect amount of booths and tables inside and outside. The atmosphere is SO much more relaxed and quiet than the Natick location. I went there within the past year and the food wasn&#39;t great, the service was slow, and there were so many people there and so much noise. Here, not only is it easy to park, there is no wait, and the service was spectacular. Everything was efficient and accurate. <br>The menu is super lengthy at The Cheesecake Factory so you are bound to find something that will peak your appetite. The meals are large and filling too. Almost no way to go wrong coming here. Again, simple parking too (not in Natick!). <br>5 stars.
Really good Chicken Enchiladas tonight from the skinny delicious menu. Ordered at the bar where I got very good friendly service.

Ok, I give it 4 stars, mostly due to value for the money and professional service. <br><br>They give you huge portions, and they are fast. It&#39;s a clean place. The staff are professional quality. The price is very good for what you get. The food is good.  It&#39;s all good!  Every restaurant should strive to be so good at the logistics and service. <br><br>Note that I rarely eat desert, so the following only applies to their entrees: I don&#39;t love their food, but everything else works like clockwork. So they deserve a solid four stars because I think they are excellent at accomplishing their goals. I just wish their food was a bit yummier.
Very nice experience! Open hall therefore safer during these times. 4 stars because the steak was well done when I asked for medium.

WOW What can I say we are in 2019 and a monster chain restaurant like the Cheesecake Factory is still cross contaminating food and Christopher Barsness THE MANAGER thinks that&#39;s its totally normal and ok as long as he tells you that no matter what what order for fried food that it will be fried in the same oil as they fry fish, I asked if he would make an exception and change the oil or make my meal separate HE SAID NO. <br>Needless to say I will never be back to the Cheesecake Factory thanks for your honesty Christopher.

Hmmmm Strangely eerie feeling,waited for 45 minutes for a table had a reservation at another restaurant but my boyfriend really wanted to go here.  Our waiter was nice but a little awkward and overall the feeling was uncomfortable the food was good I ordered the beef skirt with mashed potatoes and my boyfriend had a specially made pizza with chicken and red peppers the food was delicious <br><br>overall drinks were fine I had the red lha the Chardonnay<br><br> a martini but you check it out look at the pictures and see what I mean it was just weird<br><br> I would go to Braintree over newton nanytime no ghosts see what <br>I have tried to edit this review to fix where I had the Chardonnay and he had the martini and I can&#39;t even go back and fix it now you tell me somebody doesn&#39;t want me to write this review . either way again the food was good the place was weird it&#39;s an old place in Obviously has a lot of history and something doesn&#39;t want to be told I don&#39;t know ‍

Pissed. I came here last night and spent a lot of money... had a lot of leftovers and a waiter gave me the wrong wrapped food. Very upsetting. It&#39;s not that hard to tell someone whats in what box.

My bourgey brothers tease me because of my love for the CF. I have always called it my favorite restaurant. But tonight I lay it to rest. We already had a terrible meal at the Burlington location so this Newton location was our new stop. But today was the worst. <br><br>I thought being there at 3:30 on a Tuesday would mean quick service. The host was not warm, but the server came over immediately to take our order. The bread was served and I wondered if it had been sitting out since the lunch rush. It was not fresh. And then we waited...and waited...and waited.  No refills on the tea. <br><br>Finally got my SkinnyTaste shrimp tacos--a dish I have enjoyed.  The tacos were inedible because the tortillas were crunchy meaning they were cooked incorrectly.  You know that texture if soft tacos are left out---rubbery.  The pickled veggies on the side were not pickled. It was so bad I waved the server down to send it back. <br><br>My son had the burger and enjoyed it. But his fries never came out. He ate as much as he could of the burger and they were finally served to us in a small paper to go bag. WTH?  That bag subsequently opened in my car so then the fries were on the floor. <br><br>Asked for the manager...and waited....and she agreed that we shouldn&#39;t pay.  <br><br>Went shopping and came back (this is how loyal I was) to get cake. There were 5 people in line with angry faces. They had been waiting and waiting without even having their orders taken. So my eight-year old was devastated, but we left empty-handed.  <br><br>RIP Cheesecake Factory. I feel like this is our breakup. It is good sometimes to have closure.
The ladies room was disgusting!<br>My shoes were stuck to the floor, I sanitized them when I got  home<br>How can the help use the same facility?

Love love LOVE!!!  My bestie and i came here for an early dinner and i must say this location is where it&#39;s at!!!!  From the greeters to our waitress, everything was superb.  Our waitress Rosemary was awesome!!!  From taking pics(she&#39;s a pro y&#39;all ) to suggesting the perfect meal to suit my mood (chicken Gumbo) My bestie ended up eating my dinner and packaged his to go. I&#39;ll definitely come back to this location whenever I&#39;m back here. S/O to Rosemary girrllll you did your thing

We have been to many Cheesecake Factory but honestly we loved the service of this one. It was my friend&#39;s birthday and they decorated cake so beautifully. Avocado toast were bliss and if you are vegetarian you must try lasagna!

Whatever you do-DO NOT order delivery from this Cheesecake Factory. Tonight was the third order from them in the last six months that has arrived with either incorrect/missing items or with the complete wrong order. Door Dash is the most useless delivery app to begin with but Cheesecake Factory should take responsibility for ensuring that the correct and complete orders are given to the drivers.  Completely unacceptable. Do not waste your time.

The Cheesecake Factory is always a favorite place of mine. After my dinner this past week, my mind has been changed. <br><br>I went to dinner with my friend and her mother. We were seated at one of the tables near the bar. It was a Wednesday evening an luckily we had less than a 20 minute wait. We all share a salad and spinach dip to start. The others ordered a chicken dish and a pasta dish. Both these meals came out on time. I ordered the taquitos appetizer. They came out 10 minutes after the other dishes got delivered!!!!! They were burnt as well. The waiter didn&#39;t seem to care to check in after we got our meal. Not pleased.

This cheesecake factory had changed so much! First my water glass had green stuff on it. Looks like someone who ate salad just drink on it. Gladly Jess our server immediately changed it and apologize. <br>We ordered Chicken with waffles and Calamari.<br>When our food came in they were missing the syrup for our waffle and the hollandaise sauce was all dried up. The calamari is so rubbery and hard. I only ate half of it.  The breakfast potato taste gross as well. Overall the food is not pleasing at all. <br>The server was busy from other table who&#39;s been complaining about their food so we didn&#39;t even bother to ask her and change it.<br>Im only giving them 2 starts because the server was nice.  <br>Lastly, im not coming back to this cheesecake anymore. Me and my husband shit ourselves right after we ate their food.

Huge portions, great food. I was initially very suspicious of the Cheesecake Factory because I thought of it as a mediocre chain. However, I was proven wrong! The food is fantastic, with both the buffalo chicken pieces being very well made. The spaghetti and meatballs was hearty and nice too. Finally, the cheesecake itself is delicious! The portions are huge which is great value for money -- we had lunch for $30/pp and had enough for dinner too. I&#39;d highly recommend checking it out.
Great meat loaf dinners! Absolutely the best meat loaf that I have ever had. Spicy and very juicy, never dried out.

I think ordinarily I would have rated this 4 stars, before last night.<br><br>We have lived up here for 5.5 years. We have eaten at this Cheesecake Factory 24 times, spending a total of $2,019.26 -- an average of $84.14 a visit.<br><br>Last night we went in about 9 p.m. The place was no more than half full. The &#34;hostess&#34; had her back turned to the door, and us, for a good minute before she turned around and noticed us. Asked how she could help. (Clue: We&#39;re at a restaurant. We are here for food. Preferably at a table.)<br><br>She informed us that it would take a moment and to wait. (In a restaurant with ample seating available. Curious.) After a wait of perhaps 3 or 4 minutes, we were deemed suitable to be seated.<br><br>She took us to a dinky table. Worse: It was nasty. Filthy. When one of us pointed this out, what do you think the reply should have been?<br><br>1) I&#39;m so sorry, let me clean that.<br>2) Would you like another table?<br>3) It was just cleaned.<br><br>Well ... it was not.<br><br>However, the odds are good it will be remarkably free of $84.14 from us any time soon. Which is unfortunate, we like CF. And we&#39;re good tippers too. I&#39;m sorry &#34;hostess&#34; was maybe not having her best day, but ... we&#39;re not spending money to sit at a disgusting table.<br><br>Disappointed; we like the food generally. But not the way we were treated. We just decided to go somewhere else.

i don&#39;t usually write negative reviews, especially not for chains BUT I had a pretty negative experience at the Cheesecake Factory in Chestnut Hill today. <br>i ordered a chinese chicken salad and asked for extra oranges. after I left the restaurant (take out order) I realized the slip said &#34;no oranges&#34; and i had not been given any. I turned around and headed back to  the restaurant for the oranges. I was not apologized to, but rather treated rudely by the employee at the take out counter who acted defensively, saying &#34;I typed DOUBLe NOT NONe&#34; after I rather politely  asked for the missing oranges (I waitressed for years and years, I aim to never be rude to restaurant staff). Then arriving home and finally opening the salad (which I order at least once a week) I saw to my dismay that I was given TURKeY instead of the chicken it is supposed to come with. I do not eat turkey due to family history of gout<br><br>*Edit* I received a call from the cheesecake factory customer service. They apologized and offered me a gift card for the price of my salad. Would have preferred a refund BUT i appreciate the gesture*****<br><br>Update: customer service for the cheesecake factory called and offered me a gift card for the amount of my salad, as a way to invite me back. So I did add a star as all restaurants mess up, customer service matters.:)
I order the lunch pasta carbonara with chicken, only few pieces chicken charge for $4. extra.https://s3-media4.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/ugs_F1t0-4-KdUorX2jzYA/168s.jpg

I have been here so many times, but I always forget to take pictures or write a review. So here we go... this place is one of the best The Cheesecake factory because it is not so crowded as usual. Good service, short time on the waiting list and delicious food. I personally enjoy getting a table outside, away from de noisy family style restaurant.
Foods are delicious  bread and butter coming before your order it&#39;s so delicious you can try all the foods my favorite is chicken madeira. But Service is not perfect

Took my Son &amp; Wife here for my sons Birthday. Not very happy with this place. Thought the portion to price ratio was off. Our portions were just average. I expected more from a higher end restaurant like this. <br><br>Our table wait wasn&#39;t bad. But our wait person was awful. Our drink order taken the wait person came back &amp; accidentally split a drink on my Wife. I know accidents happen but the drink spilt all over her new coat. Not Happy!<br><br>We didn&#39;t order any appetizers so we just ordered out meals. They came out in roughly 35 minutes. thought it was a bit long. <br><br>Our food tasted Great, but like I said our portions weren&#39;t that impressive. Could have gone to Panera Bread or the Olive Garden and could have had much larger portions for less money. But my son wanted to come here for his Birthday.<br><br>Our wait staff person never came to check on us. When we were ready to leave we had to flag down a wait staff person to wrap up our left over food. The Person took our food. I ask for a slice of Cheesecake to go. The wait person said they would be right back. We waited roughly 20 more minutes. We flagged another person down they said I will be right back. The person came back only to tell us our Leftover food had been thrown away... Plus no Cheesecake either.. We paid in Disgust &amp; Left $80 spent &amp; it was a Bust. <br><br>Also we realized that after we left we were never given our Dinner salads that was supposed to have come with our meals &amp; no bread was brought to our table.<br><br>Needless to say I won&#39;t be going back to this place.

Came here today for the very first time. The food was amazing. A little pricey, but otherwise delicious. Our waitress was Crystal and although she was attentive and  helpful, and not rude in any way. She could have been a little more friendly. She never smiled once, and didn&#39;t seem happy with the 25% tip we gave her. <br>But like I said she was good at her job and I wont complain about that. <br>I would definitely go back

This five star rating is for the newest addition to their cheesecake line up - the Lemon Meringue Cheesecake.<br><br>For the longest time, to me, dessert at the Cheesecake Factory meant their luscious and light banana cream cheesecake.  But now, finally, there&#39;s a serious contender for my precious tummy real estate and dessert calorie count - the smooth and sweet lemon meringue cheesecake... yum!<br><br>There are worse things to be troubled with than which terrific slice of cheesecake to order!<br><br>*** 10/2014 visit ***<br><br>Come here for their terrific honey wheat bread, which is particularly good when served warm, and some delicious cheese cake.  If you need something else, consider the Hibachi Steak $19.95 ~ Certified Angus Hanger Steak with Shiitake Mushrooms, Onions, Bean Sprouts, Wasabi Mashed Potatoes and Tempura Asparagus.  Sure the meat portion was rather light on my plate, but what meat there was was cooked medium rare as requested, tender, and so tasty with the sweet marinade.<br><br>The chicken was tender and tasty in the Chicken Madeira $17.95 ~ Our most popular chicken dish! Sautéed Chicken Breast Topped with Fresh Asparagus and Melted Mozzarella Cheese. Covered with Fresh Mushroom Madeira Sauce and Served with Mashed Potatoes.   Although it seemed the smallest plate at the table, which was also graced by the pretty layered Luau Salad ~ Grilled Chicken Breast Layered with Mixed Greens, Cucumbers, Green Onions, Red and Yellow Peppers, Green Beans, Carrots, Mango and Crisp Wontons with Macadamia Nuts and Sesame Seeds. Tossed in Our Vinaigrette. <br><br>The Famous Factory Meatloaf, Served with Mashed Potatoes, Gravy, Grilled Onions and Corn Succotash was pretty good, though higher accolades went to the variation at Rox Cafe.<br><br>Entrees rate a 4 here.<br><br>Annoyingly, they don&#39;t seat you till the whole party is there.<br><br>*** 10/2015 ***<br><br>The warm crab and artichoke dip app $11.95 was pretty good.  The eggplant parmesan rounds surprisingly arrived alternated with breaded and fried mushroom caps.  The Hibachi Steak $19.95 was still quite good and well worth ordering.<br><br>For lunch a number of their menu items are available at a luncheon portion for a price that topped out at $14.50 for the salmon vs $18.95/$19.95 .  But consider your appetite.  The DC who ordered the dinner portion of the Luau Salad was the sole member of our party to finish their meal (not inclusive of the one who ordered the mac &amp; cheese burger $13.50).<br><br>For birthdays, if the birthday boy/girl selects a dessert, they&#39;ll decorate the plate.  If no dessert is selected, they&#39;ll bring out a scoop of ice cream with whipped cream and embarrass him/her with the staff singing a birthday song.<br><br>*** 10/2016 ***<br><br>HUGE Apple Crisp dessert!  Generous for 2.

Got to try this Cheesecake Factory, which my wife likes. Our server Chrystal was terrific. Tried a turkey burger. This is the second best turkey burger that I&#39;ve had. It was juicy. Most turkey burgers are dry. My wife had the miso salmon. I love miso since I&#39;m Japanese and from Hawaii. Overall, it was a great experience dining there.

The cleanliness....not the best. When the waitress, who was very nice the whole time, brought our drinks, the straws were sticky and could visually see dust on them. I drank my entire cup of water (via new straw) before I noticed I had lipstick marks on my cup. Waitress apologized. No explanation. Didn&#39;t offer anything else. No manager came over to talk to my husband and I. Wasn&#39;t very attentive nor empathetic in owning their errors. I won&#39;t go into detail of the woman&#39;s bathroom. We won&#39;t be going back.

I am a senior citizen who continues to work at Chestnut Hill Mall. I have worked at Bloomingdales and Brooks. I have been in every restaurant in Chestnut Hill and most of Newton. I have been insulted by the managers at Cheesecake at Chestnut Hill multiple times refusing to serve me a second glass of wine without any reason. This is done in front of my friends while I am eating meals. They are discriminatory towards seniors. I have lived in Newton for over 50 years. I have never been treated this way. I would never recommend this this restaurant for any

I had a 5 star experience tonight. I ordered one of my new favorite dishes, the &#34;Thai chicken with green curry&#34; it has snow peas, shiitake mushrooms, cashews, toasted coconut, fresh mango, and onions with white rice (also available with brown rice). The service was attentive, the food was served at the perfect temperature, the presentation was appetizing and colorful! It simply could not have been more perfect. I love their sourdough Baguettes too!

Here visiting the area, and sought out reliable TCF.<br><br>Ordered a burger platter, Falafel Salad, and chicken tacos. All tasty.<br><br>House gin martini was well-made.<br><br>Attentive service too.<br><br>Décor seemed unusually dark.<br><br>One surprising no-no:  the bill had the usual three suggested tip amounts up to 20%...but the tip calculation was based on meal + taxes. Come on. Deliberate &#34;mistake&#34; or management is mathematically challenged?<br><br>Either way, disappointed that The Cheesecake Factory management would allow this to happen.

We had a great lunch! The superfood salad of almond crusted salmon on kale was fantastic!!!!! The toddler loved her pasta and hubs was very satisfied with the lettuce wraps and soup! Such a wonderful lunch for everyone and very great customer service!!!!! My favourite Cheesecake Factory around!

It&#39;s hard to complain when the ambience is nice the service is good the food is excellent and the prices are reasonable.<br><br>Went for lunch, seems to be a bit less hectic then.<br><br>I would love a few more healthy options, but it&#39;s a cheesecake factory!<br><br>I&#39;m glad they are still in business, and I wish them well.

Its the Cheesecake Factory.  Big menu. Big plates. Big drinks.  Big cheesecake.  Big everything.  Tons of food.  There&#39;s quite literally something for everyone here.  Great for families.  Great for parties.  Awesome turkey club and mac&amp;cheese balls are insane.
Bf and I ate here last night... we started feeling nauseous in the middle of the night... Food Poisoning

Sitting and eating as I write this. Waitress is not attentive. She did not even come once to check whether we wanted something. Food was OK but not as good as it usually is. The cheesecake was wonderful though! <br><br>This used to be one of my favorite places to come to. Unfortunate. I will not return to this location. MaryAnni was our waitress i believe.
Pretty good place and good is awesome. It&#39;s inside the Chestnut Hill Mall next to Bloomingdales.

Ordered take out twice. The first time they forgot our desserts. We placed a second order just to get the desserts (one cheesecake and one apple crisp with ice cream). What we got instead was a gross pile of soggy apples with no ice cream (see picture). When we called to complain, the manager told us it was the delivery drivers fault for not knowing that there were different pick up areas for different food items in the restaurant. Even if it was the delivery driver&#39;s fault (which it wasn&#39;t), I have seen dog vomit that is more appetizing than that apple crisp. 0/10 stars

The food is phenomenal, and of course the red velvet cheesecake is out of this world. But John, our waiter, absolutely made our experience better. He was so friendly and nice and my friends and I loved him.

We were hoping to celebrate an occasion, by having dinner for two families on a Saturday night. I called on Friday but was told they don&#39;t take reservations for after 5pm. They said we can just walk in, and the wait time would be 15-20 minutes. So we made plans, everyone dressed up and I went there a little earlier to make sure we get a table. Much to my dismay, they said the wait time would be around 2 hours... <br><br>We decided to move on to another place, which is not easy on a Saturday evening with no reservations. We ended up going all the way to Coolidge Corner. Hassle and disappointment, running around with hungry kids, because the CCF does not take evening reservations, and does not communicate accurately to set realistic expectations. <br><br>What I did see in the minute we were there, is that it was crowded and loud, so I&#39;m not sure we would have enjoyed it anyway. <br>Given the high prices and our disappointing experience, I don&#39;t think we&#39;ll go there any time soon.

I ordered take out today and got the orange chicken. Took the first bite and found a bone in the chicken. I called to let the manager know and she is refunding me for the orange chicken but nothing else that I purchased. I&#39;m not really satisfied with this and feel like something else should be done since I found a bone in my food, so gross! Will not be coming back and would never recommend the Cheesecake Factory to anyone else.

The service here is friendlier than any Cheesecake Factory location that I&#39;ve ever been to. There was absolutely no wait to be seated unlike the Braintree location which is in a bigger and busier mall and there is usually at least a short wait there. I wasn&#39;t in the mood for much so I ordered the nachos. They came out perfect and I really enjoyed them. My server brought out a bread basket for me to munch on while I waited for my food to come out and the bread was very delicious and freshly baked. I&#39;ll definitely hit this place up again on my future trips to the shops at Chestnut Hill.

Cheesecake Factory is always one of my favorite spots to go because their menu is endless and their food is pretty consistent, however my experience this time wasn&#39;t as great. <br><br>Came here on a Sunday night with a group of 7 people. The hostess said there will be a 45 minute wait, but we only waited for 15-20 minutes (so that was a plus)! We got seated in a booth, couldn&#39;t fit 7 people so the hostess had to put an additional chair in the middle. <br><br>The reason I gave three stars is because I felt really rushed. Once the food came, I think halfway, she already offered us boxes. I can&#39;t even remember if she ever offered us to see the desert menu. I thought that was unprofessional and rude! I can&#39;t even enjoy a night out without being rushed! Shame! <br><br>The food here is good, like I said, pretty consistent. Some of my faves that I think are worth trying are: <br><br>Shrimp scampi <br>Louisiana chicken pasta <br>Cobb salad <br>Renee&#39;s special <br>Burger

Disappointing experience to say the least. I love CF and have frequented this location many times, but this most recent experience on 8/22 was the worst. <br><br>We arrived at 6pm to what seems like a bustling and crowded restaurant. This is to be expected as its in a mall and a favorite for everyone. The person at the front told us ten minutes max for a table for two. Thats totally reasonable! I get a buzzer and go sit down with my friend. 20 minutes later, nothing. Multiple families who came in after us are being sat before us with parties far greater than 2. Finally the buzzer lights up and we are sat. But to my confusion, I notice that the area in which we are sat, there are no joke 8-10 open tables. I understand you don&#39;t seat a section all at once, but why were we waiting 20+ minutes when there are tons of tables open? Rude. <br><br>After an additional 15 minutes of waiting for our waiter to show up. We finally are able to place a food order. We chose the nashville hot nuggets and two pasta dishes. Pretty simple, pretty quick right? My friend and I get to talking and enjoying the evening and finally realize, its almost 7:15 and we haven&#39;t gotten food yet. Where are those damn nugs? Our waiter has also disappeared and appears to only be focusing on two other tables not near us. Coooool. Someone else finally brings our nuggets out and then of course our pasta comes immediately after. Whats the point of an appetizer if we get it when our food comes? Not great timing and no apology offered by the waiter. The nuggets were cold, so thats not so great, but tasted fine. The pasta was excellent per usual, but no Parmesan was ever offered as it usually is.  Wah. We finally get the bill and leave the place at almost 8:30. I love the Cheesecake Factory, but I never intend to spend 2+ hours in a place when our original wait time was suppose to only be 20 minutes. <br><br>No bueno, next please.

I wish I could give more stars but I can not and I&#39;m sorry because Brianna was wonderful.  I was having a snack at the bar before a long drive home to NJ and a woman decides to sit next to me at the bar.  I notice she has a midsize dog with her.  I immediately got up and asked for my food to be wrapped.  The woman 2 seats away that I was chatting with motioned what&#39;s wrong?  I said I can&#39;t with the dog!  Well the women with the dog turns and said that she has rights, it&#39;s a service dog.  I said I have rights too that&#39;s why I&#39;m leaving.  I spoke politely to the manager and he said there was nothing he could do.  Oh yes there is...ask the customer already seated if it&#39;s ok to sit next to a pet.
My Mom picked up a mango cheesecake for my niece&#39;s birthday. It was the best cheesecake I&#39;ve ever tried. Shout-out to the wizard who made it - Cheers !!!!

The drinks were good! We had passion fruit mojito and lemon drop. They were both on a sweet side. Avocado eggroll was okay. Oh and we didn&#39;t get bread so we were little disappointed. Entree were amazing though! We had Steak Diane and Chicken Madeira. Chicken was well prepared and for steak diane, some parts were over cooked but over all it was delicious. The server was attentive but I felt like he was rushing us to finish.

Group of 6 and we couldn&#39;t sit together in one table . big open area with plenty of tables open, but because we are not white. Since when does it matter you can sit at the table next to you that can accommodate all of us?  . So racist .... whatever ! We hungry and we just wanna eat and leave. P.S. there was 10-15 tables open but it wasn&#39;t part of a section our server worked. Literally an invisible line to step across.

I&#39;ve been going here a lot, for years. It&#39;s ok. The food is very heavy and at times hard to digest and tolerate. The portions are big and filling. Today we had guests over and decided to order in (take out). So we ordered a Cesar Salad to start and each person got their own dish. For the main courses we ordered; Quesadilla (with Guac, Salsa and Sour Cream), Americana Burger cooked well done without the potato crisps (with fries), Shepards pie, shrimp scampi and miso salmon. We went to pick up the food at the time that we were told it was going to be ready at the front (3:07PM). We arrived and it wasn&#39;t ready yet, but it was expected because we it was Saturday afternoon and this place is always crazy packed on weekends. No worries. <br>We got the food but it ended up being cold. The salad was ok, but something about it was a bit powdery and just a tad spicy, we reckon it was the dressing. The burger was ok, cooked well done as I asked but the sauce was overpowering and took away the flavor from anything else. The Shepard&#39;s pie was decent, but was unexpected looking in terms of appearance. The shrimp scampi was good with jumbo shrimp and flavor. The quesadillas were delicious and cheesy. The fish wasn&#39;t that appealing and had an interesting smell. It&#39;s ok

Had reservation. Arrived on time. Still took 20 minutes to be seated. Drink order taken promptly but took another 20 minutes to receive the beer and an ice tea. Kitchen unable to do any variation off menu (may I have a side of mixed veggies - nope). Food served lukewarm. Wasn&#39;t a good experience.

I just want to give a huge shout out to max for his amazing customer service. Max was extremely helpful and compassionate, when we called about a food allergy. He made sure that our food was labeled and delicious.THANK YOU SO MUCH MAX!

Ok let me start off by saying, I am not the one who had the glass in the food it was my sister. I am writing this on her behalf because I&#39;m appalled about the fact that they didn&#39;t even offer to comp us for anything considering my sister had to spit glass out of her month thinking it was an onion in her salsa mix of her tex mex egg rolls. They were very nice about the whole situation but did nothing at all to help out the situation except apologize. Maybe just offer a new appetizer of the one we found the glass in.... thoughts???

Every time I have visited this restaurant, summer and most recently February, there are fruit flies that land on the food. I have brought this to the attention of the wait staff and mangers but they the managers just disregard. Disgusting! The wait staff is good, the food mediocre. Don&#39;t waste your money.

Had dinner at the Cheesecake Factory with my family last night. I was really disappointed. I&#39;ve eaten in other Cheesecake Factory restaurants many times before and not been disappointed like this.<br><br>Service <br>Service was slow and inattentive. Our food took a long time to come out and once it came out we did not see our server again till 25 minutes after we had finished eating. This was early Monday evening, the restaurant was not busy. No check on how things were going or if we needed anything. We skipped desert and bought Cheesecake at the counter to go because we got  tired of waiting. It took a long time for our meals to come out. I don&#39;t mind long wait times, its good for conversations etc but this was too long and then the food came out only lukewarm. The server omitted 1 side dish.<br><br>I ordered the pasta Jambalaya. The linguine was spongy and a mix of spinach linguine and regular which was not how it was described on the menu. The sauce was neither spicy nor cajun and the dish overall was cold. Perhaps a result of the long wait time described above.<br><br>My wife&#39;s Carne Asada was ok. You can&#39;t mess up Meatball and pasta or Chicken strips and fries.<br><br>Overall, a disappointing experience at the Cheesecake factory

Sure, it&#39;s a chain restaurant, but it&#39;s still really good. They have a million things on their menu so it&#39;s easy to accommodate everyone. Food is good and portions are huge. We got the spinach artichoke dip and it was incredible. Prices are really reasonable and the decor is nice. <br><br>The only thing that was lacking was the service. Although our waiter was super nice, he seemed to skip all the details. He brought us our drinks without straws, and he forgot the cream and sugar for my coffee. He also took a very long time to come around to acknowledge us. I don&#39;t mean to sound petty, but these are little things that we shouldn&#39;t have to ask for.

The food is great but this place is always packed with many people. The wait time to get a table on saturday dinners can be up to an hour. Since there are so many tables the waiters are not watchful and take a while to deliver your food. To get water or bread refilled you usually have to call them over. Other than the service Cheesecake Factory never disappoints. The bang bang chicken and shrimp is great and so are the pasta dishes. The lemon raspberry cheesecake is also one of my favorites.

Out of the other locations in Mass. that I&#39;ve been to, it is better service and semi-less wait time.  <br><br>Unfortunately, they do not do reservations or call ahead seating.  So when you walk in there with a party of 6 or more, expect an eye roll and sass from the people at the host stand

The food  is good and standard CF style but the service was terrible. It was my birthday  and although it was a busy night, Ive had better experiences in other CF. My carrot cake was dry and our server said she was too busy to take our photo she was running around like a mad person. She didn&#39;t  have anyone try to help and follow  up with us...pathetic. I&#39;m  a 25 to 30 percent  tipper for good service especially on my  birthday ...oh well.....

Stopped by at this cheesecake on the spur kind of moment - plenty of parking outside the mall so always convenient. We didn&#39;t have a wait and service was also pretty quick. We ordered 3 apps for two of us - spinach and cheese dip, chicken pot stickers and Tex Mex Egg rolls. As always HUGE portions so we couldn&#39;t finish everyone. The chicken pot stickers were wonderful - nice tangy taste to them. The other two apps were ok - nothing to write home about - we were in and out within 30-45 minutes. Definitely one of my better cheese cake experiences!

Oh. My. Gawd. Amazing place. The ambience is modern. Our server Gabe was outstanding... almost sweeter than the cheese cake lol. So many amazing modern twists so hard to choose. I&#39;ll be back for lunch some time, their food looks like the best in town.

The appetizers are the best of any chain restaurant. Perfect meals for the desserts that come after. I will order the chicken pot stickers or fried calamari 10 times. Don&#39;t skip trying anything here because you think other restaurants serve the same. Every chicken dish egg rolls Mexican style dishes.<br>If you want 5 star wait staff and bartenders you&#39;ll get it here with great food<br>Great locations are Chestnut Hill Back Bay Burlington Providence<br>Awesome

Out of all the Cheesecake Factory locations I&#39;ve been to in Massachusetts and California, the best service came from Donna G at this location. Best dining experience! She was so attentive and nice. She even gave us strawberry lemonade refills to go, had no idea this was an option. <br><br>The food was delicious as always. The California chicken club sandwich and Louisiana chicken pasta are always great options. Personally, I don&#39;t like cheesecake so if you like cake, Linda&#39;s Chocolate Fudge cake is a must, it&#39;s perfectly  moist. <br><br>If you ever come across Donna G as your waitress, you&#39;re in good hands!

I should have known something was wrong when the restaurant was nearly empty.  I have NEVER gone to a Cheesecake Factory and not had at least a 10 minute wait for dinner.  <br><br>Our initial server was okay.....in the beginning. He did not write down any of our orders (there were 3), so he came back a minute later and confirmed everything.  He brought us our drinks, water, bread, and was never heard from again. Other waiters brought us more water, more bread, our food, and a manager after we requested to speak with one.  All these waiters would not have been a problem if we hadn&#39;t had to ask for all these things.  Water is a basic.  And the restaurant was empty; he only had three tables. What gives? This is the first time I&#39;ve had a negative service experience at a Cheesecake Factory.  That&#39;s always been one of their things; great service to the point of being corny and annoying.  Our server was replaced with another one who was just as bad and acted like we were going to stone him.  <br><br>The food was fine and came out as ordered and it was a ton as usual per Cheesecake standards.  One of my coworkers ordered the chocolate cake, which I LOVED, and I had a bite and it&#39;s still delicious.  For this, CF gets two stars instead of one, but I wouldn&#39;t visit this restaurant again.
They let children sit at their bar.  Just FYI.  I don&#39;t agree since children don&#39;t order alcohol.
Crazy yummy food for everyone. Personal favorites: avocado egg rolls for an appetizer and pasta carbonara.  *drool*

I&#39;m happy to report that the wait wasn&#39;t long at all and the food and service were both as great as I&#39;ve come to expect from the CCF. The waiter was cheerful and very accommodating and the layout was perfect to maximize table space but still let you have a private convo with your dinner guest. It was a little weird to be in the MALL during a dinner out, especially when Uniqlo&#39;s giant display TVs are still showing wonkus visuals the whole time you&#39;re eating. I suspect this is only an issue at certain tables. I have no idea why, but I&#39;ve encountered some seriously disgusting stuff in CCF bathrooms. This place lost one star because when I reported the grossness in the bathroom to the hostess she said &#34;oh, you mean that thing in the handicap bathroom? We&#39;re working on it&#34; and DUDE, you should&#39;ve gotten that taken care of ASAP. Blech.

Food was as expected. It tasted, you know, pretty good. Flavors were definitely there.<br>Portion sizes were shockingly large. For example, my mother got a main dish that she shared with three other people at the table. We then brought it home and had a dinner for two the following night.<br><br>That means two things. <br>1) what quality meat are they using if the can afford to make close to 6 portions out of one $13 dish?<br>2) cheesecake factory is unhealthy<br><br>Cheesecake slices range from ~1000-1600 calories per slice. That is also unhealthy.<br><br>Now, if you add an appetizer and a drink to your meal.. forget super size me.. you wouldn&#39;t last a whole month.<br><br>Cheesecake factory. Get your act together. Make your portions healthier (smaller). The skinny menu is a good start but your core menu has to be healthier.

Great place to grab lunch or dinner after shopping. Many options, plenty if tables, rarely a long wait. Love the skinny menu options.  Plenty of options for kids. They also have outdoor sitting which is nice in warmer weather. The only complain about todays lunch - don&#39;t bring kids meals while they are extremely hot. Its very difficult for a parent to try to make a small child wait while the plate is right in front of them.. its unpleasant experience for a child.. keep it on the kitchen for 5-10 min if kids plate is untouchable with bare hands.

Nothing wrong with CCF if you go during the week or any other off-peak dining times.. Nothing worth waiting any real length of time for. Consistent, way too big portions.. but if you can sneak in before dinner time you can get a lunch sized portion of most of their more popular dishes. The spicy chicken chipotle pasta I had today at $12.95 is a good deal. I still had half of it to take home. At $17.95 for the dinner size it&#39;s a rip off. You&#39;ll get a pound of penne vs the 1/2 pound you get before 5PM. And it will need salt regardless of the time you have it.<br><br>Service is always decent, moody hosts and servers here &amp; there but that happens everywhere. The clientele in this particular location can be a bit ridiculous so I do consider that... <br><br>Get your cheesecake to go or else you&#39;ll end up in a food coma.

As i have written before, i am not a chain person... and I am sick of concierge at various hotels recommending the damn cheesecake factory in places we travel to, but my mother in law loves it so it is always easy to take her here when we are at malls, etc.  <br><br>This is a nice enough cheesecake factory, like all the rest, but i did love the outside (in the mall, not actually outside) seating area.  Also, we have a server named Donna who was literally the nicest person i have ever met and she was so pleasant and knowledgeable and attentive that it made our lunch very nice.<br><br>We would go back if at this mall and needed a bite.  THe food is always the same, lots of choices, freshly made, and huge portions... not something i seek out, but a good choice, especially at this mall.

Overpriced food of really bad quality. Dishes named &#34;skinny luscious&#34; are fried and served with mayo! Lol You have to wait to get a table and then wait for not very tasty food. Not worth it. I tried salmon spinach rolls - they were old and over cooked. Salmon tasted like canned. Bad experience.

Disgusting ... We asked for the tables in the terrace , the one open in the mall courtyard and noticed immediately the floor under our table was very dirty , we changed table and the floor was dirty as well and there was a little mouse trap. Maybe if you clean the floor mice are less likely to come.

A piece of glass find in my meatball pasta! How could a piece of glass mixed in pasta? Of Course  it cut my mouth a little. It&#39;s my first bite and I didn&#39;t pay that pasta but I still paid the rest of my bill. They gave me a piece of cheese cake as compensation. Actually, I didn&#39;t want any compensation and a slice of cake worth nothing. I just very upset how could a piece of glass mixed in my food? What if I swallowed it. My throat? Stomach? Couldn&#39;t imagine.

I honestly don&#39;t understand why so many people like this place.  This is my second time here, and it&#39;s still the same.  The food is salty, looks old, and is usually overcooked (they keep the lights dim for a reason!). My &#34;sauce&#34; had a layer of film over it, so you know it&#39;s been left out somewhere.  The only thing that made this experience half decent was my waiter.  I believe his name was Alex (?), but he was extremely caring and attentive, and seemed to actually be concerned about us getting decent food.  I&#39;m not coming back here, ever, but at least my waiter was decent this time around.  First time it seemed like the girl could care less.

My daughter and I love going to the Cheesecake Factory.  The service is typically great along with the food.  Unfortunately, my view changed slightly subsequent to my last visit.  My daughter had to go to the airport, therefore we asked for the food to go rather than eat at the restaurant.  When I returned home and warmed up the items, I noticed a rather long black piece of hair imbedded in my food.  That quickly put a damper on the meal and I threw it away.  An unfortunate experience.

THIS IS JUST REALLY HARD FOR ME TO EVEN SOMETIMES PUT INTO WORDS HOW MUCH I LOVE THIS PLACE! The staff are extremely friendly and it&#39;s definitely worth checking out sometime especially if you live within walking distance of this place in one of the Chestnut Hill Apartment Complexes! So I&#39;m not a cheesecake person myself but the Linda&#39;s Fudge Cake MY WORD IS SO DELICIOUS! You have to try this whether or not it&#39;s the first time you&#39;ve been to this place! Honestly at least the times that I&#39;ve been here it&#39;s never been too crowded!

What a disappointment!  Seems like the service at this location is getting worse every month....   it was one of our favorite restaurants,  love the food, nice patio to enjoy the dinner.  Unfortunately, last Saturday was the worst dining experience. We came around 8pm, noticed that there were 3-4 tables available outside and asked to be seated on the patio. Had to wait 25 min, even though tables were available and later we were seated at one of those tables. The waitress came, took an order for drinks and an appetizer, told us she will bring water and bread in a minute. 10 min later, she brought bread, no water. 5 min later we got an appetizer, still, no drinks.  Finally, drinks arrived, the waitress took the rest of the order and it was the last time we&#39;ve seen her.  We wanted to order the second round of drinks, dessert and coffee - there was no one to talk to..... she never came back!  We had to ask another waitress to either find our waitress or talk to a manager.  Well, neither Manager or our waitress  showed up.  The girl brought us the bill, apologized (even though it was not her table to take care of).   <br>The last month dining experience was not that great either. The waiter looked like he does not want be there,  took an order, brought drinks and the next time we&#39;ve seen him - when he brought the bill.  We had to tell him that it&#39;s too early for the bill, we would like a dessert menu and coffee.  He looked surprised....<br>We&#39;ve been coming to Chestnut Hill location when it was still at the Atrium Mall   We love the food at the restaurant and I hope that there will be some  improvements in customer service
Food ok, service lousy both recent trips first time server sneezed into her hand and kept working bothered time took too long to get service!

What can I say. This is a chain people. It varies location by location. Since we are in this area a lot I can say with certainty that though this new place is better than that old place at the chestnut hill atrium mall, the SERVICE IS AMONG THE WORST, for the area. <br><br>Consistently we go in here and we leave disappointed! Now with other options in the area we will reconsider this location.

Ordered sliders...the buns were greasy and seems to have been microwaved!!!  Upset my stomach.  Spinach dip is good (even though microwaved too!) but the tortilla chips were kinda stale???  Not going back.

Had the worst experience with a hosts ever. They were the most incompetent group. I have no idea what was going on but they kept telling us we were next to be seat and then proceed to seat 3 other group. They even to our pager, we had no idea where we were on the list. The female seemed  to have no idea what she was doing. She was completely useless...I can&#39;t stress this enough! One of the so called hostess was so arrogant and rude. While giving my husband and snarky remark about our wait the female hostess chuckled. I would like to know who gave these people there job! Last time we go there.

This was my first time here. Our company was treating us so my co-worker and I decided to splurge and get steaks. I had steak Diane and she had hibachi steak, $19.99 each, both came with mashed potatoes. For dessert we ordered cheesecake, I had the chocolate tuxedo cream cheese cake and she had the chocolate chip cookie dough cream cheese cake. Our waitress was friendly and gave us complimentary bread and butter to start with.

Absolutely loved the food. Although the menu is so big and the restaurant really crowded, the food tasted fresh and was quickly served. We shared the avocado eggrolls, really good! Then I had the Chicken Madeira, which was also great. Think I order the same next time. My boyfriend enjoyed his turkey burger. As dessert we ofcourse ordered some cheesecake (cookie dough and 30th anniversary) and took it with us.<br>Min: we had to wait for our turn and the waitress didn&#39;t ask us if we wanted another drink or some water. I also like if  they clean the table after the main course when it&#39;s dirty. I also don&#39;t like the interior, it&#39;s really dark in there and all the different elements make it messy

Nothing is worse than sitting in a restaurant and seeing multiple mice racing across the floor. Actually, what might be worse is the restaurant manager we spoke to telling us she knows about the mouse problem and they &#34;are working with the mall to find a solution to it.&#34; Seriously? The manager, who was very apologetic and friendly, said that the mice were coming in through a mall door but assured us that the kitchen was mouse-free and and extremely clean. Even one of the waiters told us he wouldn&#39;t eat in the area where we were sitting at because of the mouse problem. The restaurant should be closed down until you fix this problem. Disgusting.

I&#39;m usually here a couple times a month. The menu is endless and you can pretty much try something different each time you come - that goes for appetizers, entrees, and cheesecake. They have other desserts too, but I don&#39;t see why you would come to the cheesecake factory for something other than cheesecake.<br><br>The only major problem is their waiters need some extra training. They can be a little slower than expected sometimes, but I experienced one of the bigger mistakes last night - he forgot my onion rings that were part of my entree and when I asked about it, he didnt even apologize. That&#39;s probably the only thing that me from all the times I&#39;ve been. Otherwise, its a comfortable and delicious meal for the most part.

Amazing restaurant, amazing menu, amazing food, amazing service!<br>One of the best services I have ever experienced. Credit goes to Jordan, our server. He made the whole experience memorable. Will definitely be back.<br>Long waiting time. But then it was a Friday evening, so expected.

I usually go to the cheesecake location in Braintree but we came to the chestnut hill location tonight. I came here with my boyfriend on a Friday night. We only had a 15 minute wait for the 2 of us. We were seated promptly and brought drinks and bread. The food was amazing, we ordered the fettuccini alfredo with chicken and the mac n cheese burger. For dessert we ordered the chocolate chip cookie dough cheesecake which was fabulous. Our waiter, John was incredibly friendly and gave us great service. Excellent food, excellent services, and reasonable price. We will definitely be returning!!

Had a wonderful meal.  Everything delicious.  Chicken Madeira is off the hook.  Chicken potstickers also very tasty, delicious sauce.  Friends Herb Crusted Salmon fillet aromatic and perfectly cooked.  Cosmos did the job nicely and everyone&#39;s cheesecakes were delicious.  Service good, kitchen a little slow, but waiter warned us.

Nothing spectacular. Reasonable prices (except beer) and large selection. Had fish and chips and it was good. Made out of cod. Don&#39;t like chain restaurants as a rule but was outvoted by rest of my party.

Overall the service was good but the food was mediocre at best.   The Spicy chicken cashew was overcooked, the coffee tasted like it was a week old and the whipped cream clearly had something in it to make it look better, but NOT taste better...
Original cheese cake is unbelievable. Mac and Cheese balls are super good and filling:)

I&#39;ve never been a huge fan of the Cheesecake Factory, but I have to say for the amount of volume that they need to process during a busy weekend lunch hour they do an excellent job. I had the so-called Louisiana Chicken Pasta, which was moderately creamy, not swimming in butter, some breaded chicken (a bit too thin on the actual meat for my taste) and a bit of tomato, or pepper. Definitely a very large portion (we ordered dinner portions during lunch hour). A taste of buddy&#39;s Jamaican chicken revealed it to be a bit too sweet, but otherwise a solid, fair, decent meal. Can skip dinner afterwards!
Ordered a medium burger. Had to send it back twice for being over- and then under-cooked. CF is a great franchise for casual dining, but people at this restaurant need cooking classes.

First time at the Chestnut Hill location. Haven&#39;t been in years as the wait for a table is usually somewhere close to an hour at the Burlington location. <br>The wait here was 10 minutes and service was excellent. No mix ups. And the food was great!<br>The Hazelnut cheesecake was &#34;to die for&#34;!!<br>Highly recommend this location!!
Horrible service, manager Alex was even ruder than waiter. The waiter (old women ) spilled water on the child, and the manager Alex was very arrogant and rude even offered nothing

Called not once, not twice but three times to place an order for pickup. I was supposedly transferred to the cashier each time but each time after waiting for 5 minutes there was no response. I don&#39;t mind waiting and it wouldn&#39;t have been a big deal if they&#39;d at least acknowledged that I was waiting. Needless to say we ordered from another restaurant. Not sure if we will be ordering from here again.

The wait was long but expected . The service was week at best Z she was over her head from the start . The real killer was my sons food came after everyone else was served and stated getting food . The manger came to the table and offer a free slice of cheesecake ? Will never return to this outlet .

Went in here on a Sunday last weekend.  The restuarant was very busy.  There was a 15 minute way for two.  It was a very quick wait for a table.<br><br>It&#39;s amazing how fast this place is.  they DO NOT fool around.  We were seated in within 5 minutes had drinks!  <br><br>We had mushroom and buffalo chicken eggroll appetizers that were piping hot and delicious.  I was pleasantly surprised.  Also, it literally came out in less than 10 minutes!  I have no idea who fast they can whip this out to the table!<br><br>We ordered our entree&#39;s and they, too, were at our table within 10 minutes!  I had Chicken littles and they were delicious.  I would have given this a definite 5 star rating but the chicken batter on my chicken littles really needed some spices it was very bland..but, still very delicious!  I just added some salt and pepper...and it did the trick.  <br><br>I have to hand it to the Cheesecake Factory...they were amazing and handled the crowd unbelievable!  Our waitress was also quick, efficient and very sweet!  <br><br>I also heard the manager in the kitchen yell: &#34;Let&#39;s move the pace!&#34; to the cooks... HA HA!  So they are not fooling around here..
We loved eating. The chicken dim sums were so awesome. Also loved the strawberry cheesecake

This review is not about the quality of the food, but the service. This location is highly disorganized. When you order takeout, which I do frequently, they ALWAYS omit something from your order: napkins, silverware, bread, sauces that go with your order, tomatoes, the list is endless, It is so difficult to have to open and check EVERY order. My last visit there was vital missing food items in every order! Frustrating since we always tip on takeout. This happens at the bar as well.

never been a hardcore cheesecake factory fan, not for dining in anyways. I usually opt for the cheesecake take-out. <br><br>I&#39;ve never had a problem with the food or the service, it&#39;s just not my go to place. Salads are usually shared with someone and then we also split an entree. Portions are big, so save room for dessert. <br><br>My latest venture here, left me unimpressed. Our waitress wasnt that great. She couldnt describe the soup of the day off the top of her head and had to go into the kitchen to take a look at it...not usually a good sign. <br><br>I think this place is a love it or hate it kinda place. Also, this location, the whole mall is now vacant, leaving just Cheesecake factory...it&#39;s so lonely inside this mall.

So disappointed at the service at Cheesecake Factory. They gave away my dad&#39;s meal and then offered more bread or salad while we had to wait another 10 minutes for his meal. All the mean while, our meals were sitting under the heat lamp. Even though it&#39;s been sitting under the heat lamp, my meal had congealed over!! So pissed off with them right now!!!

Okay, from the start I felt uncomfortable. I use a wheelchair now and then. And the host looked at me oddly. I thought maybe it was me so I let it go. Then the waiter came and asked if we wanted bread. We said yes, normally they bring the 3 peices of bread. Maybe this place was different then she brought 2 pieces of bread for 2 people so I was like oh I guess they give the amount of bread to match how many people. But then they sat a guy with kids on the opposite side and didn&#39;t ask if they wanted bread just placed it and brought 3 peices of bread. I felt so uncomfortable. The only reason that I gave them 2 stars was because the feruchini Alfredo with chicken was good but wouldn&#39;t come here again. Maybe they don&#39;t see many Hispanic people. Not okay.

When I&#39;m not waiting 45 minutes to sit here, I&#39;m waiting just as long to be served mediocre frozen food. I don&#39;t know if it&#39;s the over priced entrees, the terrible service or the snooty attitude of the managers but CCF just doesn&#39;t do it for me. <br><br>The last time I was there I ordered a scotch and I had to send it back three times because either the cup was dirty or there were flies in it. Flies, in my scotch. I don&#39;t know, I can understand once but three? c&#39;mon CCF<br><br>I do like their Cheesecake so I suppose that&#39;s a win on their part but other than that, nothing really redeems it. Sorry guys.
Filthy table, indifferent service, and average food. Coupled with a pretty steep price tag, one can do better elsewhere.

OK, so I&#39;m in Boston with a group.  They start trying to decide on dinner, and various chains are being thrown about.  Finally, I step in.  &#34;Guys&#34;, I say, &#34;shouldn&#39;t we at least try to sample some local flavor?&#34;  Go me, right!  All agree, and we start eyeballing the famous and ancient Union Oyster House on our smart phones.  Hooray.<br><br>So what happened?  Well, we arrived at the hotel, and there&#39;s a Cheesecake Factory right across the street.  Now my companions, being lower on the cultural food chain than esteemed yelpers such as ourselves, went gaga, and begged me to reconsider my chain complaint.  And, shamefacedly, I immediately did, when I realized my per diem for dinner would cover both the Jambalaya and a piece of cheesecake.  Don&#39;t worry, I flogged myself later for giving in.<br><br>So now you know that this place is one of my guilty pleasures.  I mean, you can&#39;t offer me Dutch Apple Caramel Streusel cheesecake, or on this visit, Caramel Pecan Turtle cheesecake, and expect me to resist.  This was my first time with the Turtle, and whoa was it freaking delicious.  I am sure it&#39;s one of the worst things for you to eat, but hey, without stuff like this what&#39;s the point of living?<br><br>This particular location was nice.  It&#39;s on the lower level of the mall, and they were able to seat us immediately on a Wednesday night.  We had great service for our party of 8, and everyone was very happy with what they ordered.  Especially those of us who indulged in the cheesecake.  Down here in Georgia, these places are always madhouses, so it was nice to be able to walk into one and look at the cakes without being jostled by a bunch of people.  For the record, I may have just been insanely hungry, but the jambalaya pasta came out better here than I have ever had it before.  Simply wonderful!

I usually love that place but last time i was there i ordered a coffee and when i took out a pack of sugar it was full of holes- as if a mouse had been around it.<br>They claimed they had no mice and refused to open a new pack of sugar for me. Instead they simply didnt charge me for my coffee. I wanted to drink it but i wanted my sugar and they did not want to open a new sugar box so no coffee for me

The server was hilarious! sarcastic, funny, chill, and gave us space. carbonara had an overly salty flavor that basically took over the entire dish. It was surprisingly bland other than this one note. The sliders were ok, but the meat was really just way too salty and fatty, and didnt seem high quality. <br><br>MY ONE complaint, is that he manager was pushy, rude, and tried to take over the waitresses responsibilities and make her look like she wasn&#39;t doing her job. It was so bad that i put in a complaint. I can&#39;t handle men thinking they can be totally rude and domineering over female staff, or any staff for that matter! it ruined the entire night to have that cloud of superiority on the dinner table. <br><br>SO, overall, eh, it is the CCF, but i like the one in Boston far more than i like this one.

I called the Cheesecake Factory - Chestnut Hill asking for the wait on a table of 10. The host was really rude and he said that there was going to be a 2 hours wait. I said it was fine and told him we were about to walk in. He was even ruder and said &#34;If you walk in now it will be a 3 hour wait&#34;. 5 minutes after I spoke to him, someone from my party walked in. A hostess was really nice and told her the wait was 45 min. I asked for the host name and he said &#34;Mario&#34;, but It was the host working around 8pm on Wednesday 02/18/2015. He was very unprofessional and rude. We almost gave up on going because of him. We felt like he didn&#39;t want us to come in. We did anyways because we were already in the area. I have been going this restaurant for years and never had this problem. I hope the manager addresses this issue. I will be writing another review for the waiter (TOD) because he was the best!

Waited 40 min for table. Ordered Nachos off the menu and they were on the bland side. We were anxiously awaiting the artichoke dip but ended up with a burnt artichoke and dipping sauce. Waitress was great but definitely not worth the wait and outing.

The night started off fine with a drink at the bar while waiting for an outside table. Also if our waitress  wasn&#39;t such a delight this would be one star review. We ordered a salad , and two ribeye steaks , our food did take a little longer than usual to arrive but we were enjoying our conversation so we didn&#39;t mind too much. A &#34;manager&#34; came over to apologize that they have run out of ribeye steak -seems odd to say that now it&#39;s been 45 mins and the kitchen is just making our food now? Hard to believe. No worries my friend wasn&#39;t upset she ordered the filet , rare. The manager or whoever she was comes back to tells us she wants to bring the other steak out and salad so food doesn&#39;t overcook, okay fine. Our waitress comes by and sees we&#39;re missing a ribeye and wasn&#39;t told of the kitchen mistake. Very disappointing that the lines of communication at this place are in total disarray. The real reason no ribeye, it went to the wrong table. How frustrating. And what&#39;s with the lie? Put on another ribeye. Maybe they did run out. Oh! During said chaos we gave our compliments to the male manager on duty about our waitress, she tells us he told her we said she was weird! Totally wasn&#39;t what we said! I think there&#39;s issues with staff and management at this place. Not sure we will be back.

Well, I&#39;d never been to Cheesecake Factory before, but my boyfriend thought this would be a great Valentine&#39;s Day dinner location.<br><br>Yeah, him and about half of outlying Boston, apparently.<br><br>We got there around 730 and were told it would be roughly a half-hour wait to be seated. Taking the initiative, and because I was excessively thirsty, we made our way to the bar and self-seated immediately at a four-seater high-top with a view of the Minnesota/Wisconsin game. It took a while for a server to find us, but that&#39;s more than excusable on a holiday.<br><br>Our server, Rachel, was a gem. Funny, informative and very attentive, she was always in the periphery if we needed her. We started with a chocolate martini - not on the menu, but they&#39;ll make it for you - and a Long Island iced tea, plus waters and the quintesential bread basket. <br><br>Head&#39;s up to the bread baker, and I know they have one because I saw a guy walking around with a giant platter of breads, but that is the hardest, least palatable Italian loaf I have tasted that wasn&#39;t on the clearance rack at Stop and Shop. The multi-grain was fantastic, though, and we devoured it before our apps.<br><br>Word to the wise, this is an amazing date location. We shared a Boston Cobb salad, which was well garnished and portioned appropriately to share. We then had the Hibachi steak, and OH GOD, can you say perfect medium rare? The best temperature for a skirt steak, which I know it was, but hey, cooked with that marinade the cut was great. The wasabi mash, tempura asparagus and roasted mushrooms were perfect. Delectable. Amazing and fantastic, and we have half of it in the fridge because there was just so much.<br><br>We got two slices of cheesecake to go, thanks to Rachel&#39;s suggestions. Coffee and the end of the basketball game were compliments of the manager, whose name I never got. A very pleasant, smiling lady, and I appreciated her attentiveness.<br><br>This business is in the Atrium Mall, and while the rest of the structure is vacant, I hope they stick around. First visit but not the last! Only would have been better if my boyfriend proposed, but we&#39;ll give these things time.

Let&#39;s see, we came here for Sunday brunch....my main complaint is that I was stupid enough to eat and drink here for 3 hours before ending up at Yard House at Legacy Place in dedham (a SUBSTANTIALLY superior dining/brunch experience).<br><br>I ordered sliders for food, and was constantly pressured to order more food, even though their sliders are essentially 3 overcooked (despite asking for PINK center) mini burgers with no toppings and bun that came out of a plastic bag a few minutes ago. While I was waiting for Burger King delivery from their kitchen, I was treated to ambivalent service from our waitress who pressured us for more food, but kept forgetting our drinks.<br><br>I also had 2 bloody mary&#39;s which tasted &#39;skunky&#39; (not sure how you do that) but I suspect their tomato juice went bad and overall it was a terrible experience. The fact that it was sunny out and I was in good company saved the experience, but despite the fact that we were the only people there, Cheesecake Factory managed to screw up something so basic as Sunday Brunch in suburbia.<br><br>The only redeeming quality about this place is that you can observe suburban russian jewish girls here, discussing #firstworldproblems and talking about their plans to marry a financial analyst that went to brandeis and their plans to go get drunk in Boston.

The food, just like every Cheesecake Factory, is not bad. We had a collection of appetizers rather than main courses. Tuna avocado salad was tiny, but good and fresh. Salmon firecrackers were a little overcooked, but good. Mini carb cakes where very cheesy - yes cheesy - where is the crab meat? Calamari were okay, albeit unremarkable. Red velvet cheesecake was to die for. Their tab water is filtered and drinkable. <br><br>Knock though - club soda was unbearably loaded with chlorine. I sent it back and got a new one. I told waiter David that it is not fit for human consumption and asked for more regular water instead. I still was charged $3 for the soda. Rather than arguing, I deducted $3 from the tip which made it uncharacteristically low. <br><br>Don&#39;t drink anything out of their soda fountain!!! Don&#39;t give the sodas to your kids.

Great food and drinks, if the waitress listens to what you order. <br>It seems like victoria( the waitress) had her mind in something else the whole night. <br>I ordered a Malibu and pineapple, and my friend asked for a chocolate martini. <br>Victoria came back and asked me what I ordered. I said Malibu and pineapple. <br>What we received was 2 martinis. <br>The Malibu you could barely taste... For 10.00- I was ripped off!<br>Victoria needs to cheer up! I gave the lowest tip ever.

I flew up to Boston from California  to surprise my best friend for her 30th Birthday. I took her to the cheesecake factory to have dinner and dessert on August 5, 2018 and as we were sitting there I saw a mouse run by. I immediately got up and requested to speak to a manager. As I was waiting I asked one of the servers if he knew that they had mice and he said yes we do get them from time to time because of where their eatery is positioned (NO EXCUSE), so the manager comes and I ask her if she knows that they have mice and she immediately says no. When I repeat to her what one of her staffers said about having mice from time to time she immediately changed her story and confirmed his story and said yes we have mice from time to time. She said that she was going to contact the mall about it and offered to move our seats several times and I said what is moving our seats going to do? You all have mice. We had already ordered and she gave us the food for free but there wasn&#39;t an apology and people should not have to come into a restaurant and experience that especially since we were there celebrating a 30th birthday.

Worst experience last weekend. We went in Saturday for lunch and there was no wait. Some how all of the orders were messed up. The manager came over 30 mins later to apology but that was it. At any other restaurant you would get something free or something

So, I&#39;m confused by the reviews and ratings for this Cheesecake Factory. We live in the area and are there quite often! The servers and staff have always been wonderful to us! I am often there with 3 kids which if anything would merit rude behavior, but none has ever been expressed! The food is always good ( sometime son busy nights it takes a bit) but overall I have never had any issues with this location! We love it here and have many reasons to return!

Five stars for the cheescake; one star for the pasta.<br><br>The &#34;Pasta with Meat Sauce&#34;  entree was slightly large as a portion and miffled with too much oil. The sauce was lacking in meat and had a consistency that separated itself from the pasta (i.e. when the pasta was gone, the plate was filled with it.) Overall, the meal didn&#39;t go down as well as I expected. I&#39;ll try something else next time.<br><br>Apart from that, the cheesecake was amazing! I had the Godiva Chocolate, which was a nicely garnished confection with a tangy crust. I relished every forkful!

Typical cheesecake &#34;factory&#34; menu.  Ordered the usual items but was terribly disappointed by the portion.  Service was also very factory like, but nothing genuine.  We ordered appetizers but no inquiry as to if we wanted everything all at once or slowly.  My entire dinner service consisted of 1 entree per guest &amp; 1 drink per guest.  I was so thirsty that I might have considered drinking the toilet water.  As we were leaving; I think I saw &#34;please don&#39;t come back&#34; in my rear view mirror.

I have to say that I do not see the fawning praise people give the food at The Cheesecake Factory.  My wife and I went here for brunch and found the food mediocre and the service below average.  Our orders were taken promptly and things went down hill rapidly from there. My eggs were moderately warm.  They probably would have been served hot if the server/bus person hadn&#39;t walked around the restaurant for 3 to 5 minutes trying to find our table.  Someone couldn&#39;t give them a table number???<br><br>The next big issue was that I received my toast both dry as dirt and burnt as did my wife.  I had to ask twice for butter which resulted in us getting 3 slices of butter.  I did not realize The Cheesecake Factory was so hard up that they couldn&#39;t butter toast and tried to prevent customers from doing so.  Our waitress reappeared at check time but was sorely missed when we needed her! <br><br>Overall this is a way too pricy for such mediocre food and poor service.  You can do much better!
Rock hard tomatos, terrible presentation, but expensive.  Weird decoration, poor lighting, and loud.  <br><br>Our server was nice.

As far as cheesecake factories go this place is run of the mill. Obviously they have good cheesecake and dinner is ok unless the place is slammed in which case there is a long wait and the place becomes a bit chaotic. Had the filet and although it doesn&#39;t compare to a Boston steak house it wasn&#39;t bad

Chain restraunt but this location was on the better side of nice.  The food are what we expected, but the portions were way too big.  Next time we order for one and split the dish.  The bar was showing the Pats game and there was lots of good seats to watch the game and recover from christmas shopping madness.  The waitress was really good.
